claim: Walking into a wardrobe in real life does not cause any particular thing to happen.

supporting.text: Wardrobes are physical objects designed for storage and do not possess any mechanisms to cause events when entered.

attacks.text: Wardrobes are physical objects designed for storage and do not possess any mechanisms to cause events when entered.
Some wardrobes may have hidden mechanisms or be part of interactive installations, which could trigger events when entered.
Such hidden mechanisms are extremely rare and not representative of typical wardrobes.
Entering a wardrobe could cause psychological or imaginative experiences, such as recalling childhood memories or triggering creative thoughts.
These experiences are subjective and not caused by the wardrobe itself, but by the individual's mind.

supporting.text: There is no scientific evidence or physical law suggesting that entering a wardrobe triggers any specific phenomenon.

attacks.text: There is no scientific evidence or physical law suggesting that entering a wardrobe triggers any specific phenomenon.
Some wardrobes contain hidden mechanisms or secret compartments that could trigger events when entered.
Hidden mechanisms in wardrobes are extremely rare and not a typical feature of standard wardrobes.
Entering a wardrobe could trigger psychological or perceptual phenomena, such as hallucinations or altered states, in certain individuals.
Such psychological phenomena are not caused by the wardrobe itself but by pre-existing conditions or external factors.

supporting.text: In everyday experience, walking into a wardrobe results only in the person being inside the wardrobe, with no additional consequences.

attacks.text: In everyday experience, walking into a wardrobe results only in the person being inside the wardrobe, with no additional consequences.
In rare cases, wardrobes may contain hidden mechanisms or traps that trigger unexpected events when entered.
If the wardrobe is unstable or poorly constructed, walking into it could cause it to collapse, leading to injury.
Hidden mechanisms in wardrobes are extremely rare and typically only exist in fictional or highly specialized contexts.
Modern wardrobes are generally built to safety standards that minimize the risk of collapse under normal use.

supporting.text: Wardrobes are constructed from inert materials like wood or metal, which cannot produce effects beyond their structural properties.

attacks.text: Wardrobes are constructed from inert materials like wood or metal, which cannot produce effects beyond their structural properties.
Some wardrobes may contain hidden mechanisms or electronic components that could trigger effects when interacted with.
Hidden mechanisms in wardrobes are extremely rare and not representative of typical wardrobes.
Wardrobes in fictional or augmented reality settings can produce effects beyond their structural properties.
The claim specifies 'in real life,' excluding fictional or augmented reality scenarios.

supporting.text: No documented cases exist of wardrobes causing unusual events when entered, as confirmed by mainstream records and observations.

attacks.text: No documented cases exist of wardrobes causing unusual events when entered, as confirmed by mainstream records and observations.
Historical folklore and myths, such as the legend of the Narnia wardrobe, suggest wardrobes can act as portals to other realms.
Folklore and myths are not empirical evidence and do not represent documented cases in mainstream records.
Wardrobes in certain cultures are believed to have spiritual significance, and entering them may trigger supernatural events.
Such beliefs are anecdotal and lack scientific validation, making them unreliable as evidence against mainstream observations.
